headline: Nvidia Fails to Reassure—Heard on the Street Recap
summary: Nvidia’s shares fell 5.5% despite record income as investors' high expectations for AI bellwethers continue to create a difficult bar for companies to clear.  One particular problem, notes Heard columnist Dan Gallagher, is that the company’s runaway success could be seen as a sign of the destabilization to come, given the massive amounts of capital-spending filling its coffers are financially weakening the world’s largest companies from Amazon to Microsoft.  The Nasdaq and S&P 500 both declined following Nvidia's slide, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average remained relatively flat and Treasury yields inched lower.

raw.headline: Nvidia Fails to Reassure—Heard on the Street Recap
raw.summary: Nvidia’s shares fell 5.5% despite record income as investors' high expectations for AI bellwethers continue to create a difficult bar for companies to clear.  One particular problem, notes Heard columnist Dan Gallagher, is that the company’s runaway success could be seen as a sign of the destabilization to come, given the massive amounts of capital-spending filling its coffers are financially weakening the world’s largest companies from Amazon to Microsoft.  The Nasdaq and S&P 500 both declined following Nvidia's slide, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average remained relatively flat and Treasury yields inched lower.

headline: As Nvidia stock dips, have investors been 'hating on AI' in 2026?
summary: US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) broadly end Thursday trading in negative territory — the Dow Jones Industrial Average only rose by 0.03% — while Nvidia (NVDA) closed nearly 5.5% lower after the AI chipmaker's strong fourth quarter earnings apparently wasn't enough to impress Wall Street investors. Grenadilla Advisory founder and CEO Anna Rathbun speaks with Josh Lipton to share her analysis of Nvidia's earnings release and where the semiconductor manufacturer is seeing the most pressure from AI investors. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Will AI Kill Software? Fear Creeps Beyond 'Saaspocalypse,' Hits IBM, DoorDash
summary: IBM, the 115-year old enterprise tech behemoth, doesn't have a ton in common with 13-year-old food-delivery app operator DoorDash.  IBM stock on Monday was stung with its worst single-day loss since 2000, with a 13% dive prompted by a blog post from AI startup Anthropic.  DoorDash fell more than 6% that same day after a viral Substack post from Citrini Research pegged its business as a potential "poster child" for marketplaces disrupted by AI.

DoorDash fell more than 6% that same day after a viral Substack post from Citrini Research pegged its business as a potential "poster child" for marketplaces disrupted by AI.

summary: Salesforce stock (CRM) is trending slightly in Thursday's trading session after releasing fourth quarter earnings results that topped estimates. As software companies recover from February's waves of AI-induced sell-offs, how do investors feel about Salesforce's Agentforce services? Guggenheim Securities senior research analyst and senior managing director of software, John DiFucci, assesses the performance of Agentforce business in Salesforce's last quarter, while also giving his broader view on other software providers. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Salesforce Eases AI Fears With Strong Outlook and Big Buybacks
summary: Salesforce Inc. gave a strong outlook for long-term sales and announced a large share buyback, helping assuage some of Wall Street's fears about AI disruption of the software industry.  "We're well on our way" to $63 billion in annual revenue in fiscal year 2030, Chief Executive Officer Marc Benioff said Wednesday in a statement. Wall Street was expecting $60.3 billion. The company also announced a new $50 billion stock buyback program and increased its quarterly dividend to 44 cents per share. Bloomberg's Anurag Rana joins to discuss.

Wall Street was expecting $60.3 billion. The company also announced a new $50 billion stock buyback program and increased its quarterly dividend to 44 cents per share. Bloomberg's Anurag Rana joins to discuss.

headline: 3 reasons Salesforce earnings failed to impress investors
summary: Salesforce (CRM) reported fourth quarter earnings results on Wednesday after the closing bell. Adjusted earnings per share (EPS) beat Wall Street's expectations, coming in at $3.81 (compared to analyst estimates of $3.05), while revenue only narrowly beat expectations at $11.2 billion (compared to analyst estimates of $11.17 billion). Yahoo Finance Technology Editor Dan Howley and Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi sit down with Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to discuss where the earnings results fit into the broader software sector (IGV) sell-off and how the company needs to proceed moving forward. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

summary: Investing.com - Over the last month or so, markets have been gripped by a grim narrative: the “SaaSpocalypse.” As agentic AI surged, investors fled traditional software names like Salesforce, ServiceNow, SAP, Cadence, Synopsys, and even legacy giants like IBM, on fears AI agents would replace the need for software altogether. headline: C3.ai wants to capture AI scaling with 'maximum flexibility': CEO
summary: C3.ai stock (AI) is taking a hit in Thursday trading after the artificial intelligence developer reported a larger-than-expected loss in its fiscal third quarter (a loss of $0.40 per share vs. estimates of $0.29) while missing revenue estimates. C3.ai CEO Stephen Ehikian speaks with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi about the company's AI enterprise business, its partnerships with the US government, and the current narratives surrounding the software industry. Ehikian previously served as the vice president of product at Salesforce (CRM). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Salesforce Earnings Were Finally Good Enough for the Stock
summary: Salesforce  stock dropped in premarket trading Thursday after the software company reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter financials.  The cloud pioneer reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $3.81 a share on revenue of $11.2 billion.  Analysts surveyed by FactSet were expecting adjusted earnings of $3.05 a share on revenue of $11.19 billion.

headline: Revenue & Marketing Builders Join Reevo to Deliver AI-Native Revenue Operating System to Customers
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., February 26, 2026--Reevo, builders of the AI-native platform that transforms fragmented tool stacks into one intelligent GTM engine, today announced the additions of Naman Khan as Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) and Ali Ghotbi as Chief Revenue Officer (CRO). These hires build on the 4x surge in demand for Reevo’s Revenue Operating System since its November 2025 debut and $80 million fundraise co-led by Khosla Ventures and Kleiner Perkins.

raw.headline: Revenue & Marketing Builders Join Reevo to Deliver AI-Native Revenue Operating System to Customers
raw.summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., February 26, 2026--Reevo, builders of the AI-native platform that transforms fragmented tool stacks into one intelligent GTM engine, today announced the additions of Naman Khan as Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) and Ali Ghotbi as Chief Revenue Officer (CRO). These hires build on the 4x surge in demand for Reevo’s Revenue Operating System since its November 2025 debut and $80 million fundraise co-led by Khosla Ventures and Kleiner Perkins.

headline: Virtualitics Names Salesforce's Dave Rey as New Board Member
summary: Virtualitics, the category leader in AI-native readiness applications for defense, government and critical infrastructure, today announced that Dave Rey will join the Board of Directors. Rey brings deep experience in software as a service (SaaS) sales for public sector customers, including from his current role as President of Sales, Global Public Sector at Salesforce.

headline: US stock futures waver as Nvidia's blockbuster results draw muted response
summary: U.S. stock index futures were muted on Thursday as Nvidia's stellar quarterly results garnered a lukewarm response from investors and downbeat earnings from software company Salesforce weighed on ‌sentiment. Nvidia inched 0.6% higher in premarket trading after the chipmaker posted better-than-expected results for the January quarter ‌and forecast current-quarter revenue above market estimates. "The needle has clearly shifted when it comes to what its going to take to convince investors ​that the billions being poured into AI infrastructure will pay off," said Raffi Boyadjian, lead market analyst at Trading Point.

"The needle has clearly shifted when it comes to what its going to take to convince investors ​that the billions being poured into AI infrastructure will pay off," said Raffi Boyadjian, lead market analyst at Trading Point.

headline: Salesforce Uses Momentum Deal To Turn Calls Into CRM Value Question
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) has acquired conversational AI platform Momentum to feed voice and video data into Agentforce 360 and Slackbot. The deal is aimed at automating the ingestion and analysis of unstructured customer conversations from third party channels for enterprise sales teams. The company plans to use Momentum’s technology to turn previously untracked calls and meetings into CRM insights that support sales workflows. Salesforce, trading at $191.75, is taking this step at a time when...
